properties.areaDesc: McDowell Mountains; Mitchell; Caldwell Mountains; Avery; Yancey; Burke Mountains
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 7 at 3:28AM EST until January 7 at 4:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg SC
properties.description:
...A MIXED BAG OF WINTRY PRECIPITATION WILL IMPACT THE NORTHERN
NORTH CAROLINA MOUNTAINS THIS MORNING...

.A low pressure system, a cold front, and associated moisture,
will cross the southern Appalachians this morning. This moisture
will encounter air cold enough to produce a mixture of snow,
sleet, and freezing rain across the northern North Carolina
mountains. Temperatures will warm gradually from the southwest
through late morning, but then fall again through the afternoon
along the higher ridges behind the departing front - permitting
snow showers to continue or return across the higher elevations.
Windy conditions will develop this afternoon as well.

* WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Snow, sleet, and freezing
rain will likely produce snow accumulations of 1 to 2 inches,
along with a light glaze of ice from the freezing rain. Winds
may gust as high as 40 mph this afternoon.

* WHERE...The northern mountains of western North Carolina,
especially across Avery County and also the higher elevations
throughout the northern mountains.

* WHEN...Until 4 PM EST this afternoon.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous
conditions could impact the morning commute. Windy conditions
this afternoon could yield a few power outages.
properties.instruction:
Allow extra travel time and stopping distance if driving across
the northern mountains today. Be especially cautious on steep
roadways.

Please report snow and ice accumulations by calling the National
Weather Service toll free at...1...800...2 6 7...8 1 0 1. Leave a
message with your observation and the specific location where it
occurred. You can also post your report to the National Weather
Service Greenville Spartanburg Facebook page, or tweet your
report using hashtag nwsgsp.

Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio or your favorite source of
weather information for the latest updates. Additional details
can be found at www.weather.gov/gsp.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON
